Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.ffmpeg_encode_cmodel_compare_runner

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function

import re
import logging
import os


from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.test_utils_base import TestUtilsBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.site_utils import SiteUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.result_handler import ResultHandler



[docs]class FfmpegEncodeCmodelCompareRunner(TestUtilsBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self, host, args):
        self.user_args = args
        self.command_output = ""
        self.cmd_options = []
        self.timeout = 300
        self.stream = ""
        self.bitrate = ""
        self.encoder_lib = ""
        self.encoder = ""
        self.host = host
        self.bitrates = []
        self.ssimys = []
        self.outfile = ""
        self.infile = ""



[docs]    def test_setup(self):
        self.generate_args(self.user_args)



[docs]    def run_ffmpeg_encode_cmodel_compare(self):
        cmd = self._gen_cmd_line()
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Running - {}".format(cmd))
        command_output = self.host.run(cmd, timeout=self.timeout)
        return command_output


    def _gen_cmd_line(self):

        self.outfile = re.sub("video_tools/jim_y4ms/", "", self.stream)

        if (re.match(".*264", self.encoder_lib) is not None):
            self.outfile = re.sub(".y4m", "_B%s.h264" % self.bitrate, self.outfile)
        elif (re.match(".*265", self.encoder_lib)is not None):
            self.outfile = re.sub(".y4m", "_B%s.hevc" % self.bitrate, self.outfile)
        elif (re.match(".*hevc", self.encoder_lib)is not None):
            self.outfile = re.sub(".y4m", "_B%s.hevc" % self.bitrate, self.outfile)
        elif (re.match(".*vp9", self.encoder_lib)is not None):
            self.outfile = re.sub(".y4m", "_B%s.ivf" % self.bitrate, self.outfile)
        else:
            raise TestError("Unsupported test encoder_lib {}".format(self.encoder_lib))

        cmd = self.encoder + " -i " + self.infile + " "
        for arg in self.cmd_options:
            key = (list(arg.keys())[0])
            value = (list(arg.values())[0])
            if (value) is True:
                cmd += " %s" % (key)
            else:
                cmd += " %s %s" % (key, value)

        log_dir = SiteUtils().get_log_dirs()
        self.outfile = os.path.join(log_dir["resultsdir"], self.outfile)
        cmd = cmd + " " + self.outfile

        return cmd


[docs]    def generate_args(self, args):
        """
        fixes the timeout, input and output file args to be run with ffmpeg cmd

        @param args: a list of key/value pairs provided by user
        @return: returns a list of key/value pairs of the updated arguments
        """

        for arg in self.user_args:
            key = (list(arg.keys())[0])
            value = (list(arg.values())[0])
            if (key == "encoder"):
                self.encoder = value
                self.user_args.remove(arg)
            if (key == "-c:v"):
                self.encoder_lib = value
            if (key == "bitrate"):
                self.bitrate = value
                self.user_args.remove(arg)

        for arg in self.user_args:
            key = (list(arg.keys())[0])
            value = (list(arg.values())[0])
            if (key == "-timeout"):
                self.timeout = value
            elif (key == "stream"):
                self.infile = os.path.join(SiteUtils().get_tool_path(), value)
                self.stream = value
            elif (key == "-vk-params"):
                value = re.sub("bitrate=x", "bitrate=%s" % self.bitrate, value)
                arg = {key : value}
                self.cmd_options.append(arg)
            else:
                self.cmd_options.append(arg)



[docs]    def start_test(self):
        self.command_output = self.run_ffmpeg_encode_cmodel_compare()
        logging.info("stream completed successfully")



[docs]    def parse_results(self):
        """
        Parses the videocorrectness log
        """
        ouput_logfile = self.outfile + "_encode.log"

        with open(ouput_logfile, 'a') as logfile:
            logfile.write(self.command_output)

        test_results = self.parse_values(self.command_output)
        passed = False
        if test_results is not None:
            result_handler = ResultHandler()
            result_handler.add_test_results(test_results)
            passed = True

        if not passed:
            raise TestError("Did not find 'PASS' status in output")



[docs]    def parse_values(self, cmd_output):
        test_results = {}
        frames = 0
        fps = 0
        bitrate = ""
        speed = ""
        ssim_y = 0

        for line in cmd_output.split("\n"):
            m = re.search(r"kb/s:([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                bitrate = m.group(1)
            m = re.search(r"frame=\s+([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                frames = m.group(1)
            m = re.search(r"fps=\s+([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                fps = m.group(1)
            m = re.search(r"bitrate=\s+([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                bitrate = m.group(1)
            m = re.search(r"speed=\s+([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                speed = m.group(1)
            m = re.search(r"MEAN PSNR.*SSIM Y:([0-9]+)", line)
            if (m is not None):
                ssim_y = m.group(1)

        log_dir = SiteUtils().get_log_dirs()
        encode_name = re.sub(log_dir["resultsdir"], "", self.outfile)
        encode_name = re.sub("/", "", encode_name)
        test_results['%s_frames' % encode_name] = frames
        test_results['%s_bitrate' % encode_name] = bitrate
        test_results['%s_fps' % encode_name] = fps
        test_results['%s_speed' % encode_name] = speed
        test_results['%s_ssim_y' % encode_name] = ssim_y
        return test_results



[docs]    def diff_check(self):
        log_dir = SiteUtils().get_log_dirs()
        ref_file_name = re.sub(log_dir["resultsdir"], "", self.outfile)
        ref_file_name = re.sub("_mve", "", ref_file_name)
        tool_path = SiteUtils().get_tool_path()
        enc_ref_file_path = "video_tools/brcm_mve_encoded_ref_files/"
        ref_file = os.path.join(tool_path, enc_ref_file_path + ref_file_name)
        out_file = self.outfile
        diff_output = self.host.run('diff -s -q {0} {1}'.format(ref_file, out_file))
        logging.info(diff_output)
